newsitem.title: ESTONIA: MAAPANK TO SEEK LISTING THIS YEAR.
newsitem.headline: MAAPANK TO SEEK LISTING THIS YEAR.

text.p: Estonia's Maapank (Land Bank) said on Wednesday that it will seek a listing on the Tallinn stock exchange this year.
"We will seek a listing on the stock excange either at the end of the first half of this year or the beginning of the second half," Malle Eenmaa, Maapank chairman, told news conference.
Maapank is currently holding a share issue worth 51.5 million kroons which will end on June 12.

Eenmaa made her comments on the listing during the signing of an agreement with the European Bank of Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) for an investment worth 24 million kroons and a seven million kroon subordinated loan with Swedbank.
Earlier, the EBRD said that it hoped Maapank will seek a listing on the stock exchange.
"We hope our investment in Maapank will facilitate a stock exchange listing in due course," the EBRD's representative to Estonia, Johathan Harfield, told Reuters.
Maapank is the sixth bank among the 13 Estonian commercial banks. Its assets were 1.1 billion kroons in the first quarter. -- David Mardiste, Tallinn newsroom, +372 630 8400 reuters@reuters.ee
